newsitem.title: USA: Durham, N.C., plans hearing on GO bond proposals.
newsitem.headline: Durham, N.C., plans hearing on GO bond proposals.

text.p: City of Durham, N.C., scheduled a public hearing for Sept 16 on five proposed general obligation bond issues totalling $86.3 million, a city clerk said Wednesday.

The bond issues were formally proposed by the City Council Tuesday night and were previously endorsed by the council's finance committee. If approved after the public hearing they would go on the Nov 5 ballot.
The issues include $35.2 million for streets, $20.375 million for parks and recreation, $20 million for housing, $5.165 million for public transit and $5.5 million for arts and museums.
If voters approve all five, the city's property tax rate would rise by six cents per $100 of assessed value.
